Dialogue: You couldn't even think about trying to escape until the sedation eases-

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: Decades-it could be infinite-I don't know! Ask him-he's the one who's been there before!

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Great. So now we're stuck in Fischer's mind battling it out with his private army, and if we get hit we're stuck in Limbo 'til our brains dissolve into scrambled egg?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Let's just get him upstairs.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Hold this. Firm pressure.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You knew the risks and you didn't tell us.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: There wasn't meant to be any risk. We weren't supposed to be dealing with a load of gunnre.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You had no right.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: It's the only way you can go three layers deep, Arthur.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: And you. You went along with this?

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: I trusted him.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You trusted him? When? When he promised you half his share?

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: No! His whole share. Plus, he told me he'd done it before.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Oh, yeah? With Mal? That worked out great, didn't it, Cobb?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You don't know anything about that. This was the only way to do this job, Arthur. I did what I had to do to get back to my children.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: So you led us into a war zone with no way out.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We have a way out. The kick. We just have to push on, do the job as fast as possible and get out using the kick.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Forget it. We go any deeper, we just raise the stakes. I'm sitting it out on this level.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You'll never make it, Eames. Fischer's security is surrounding this place as we speak. The ten hours of the flight is a week at this level-you'll never make it without getting killed. Downwards is the only way forwards. We have to carry on.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: And we have to do it fast.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Eames, go get ready. Arthur, let's get in there and soften him up.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I'm insured against kidnapping up to ten million-this'll be simple-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No, it won't.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: In. your lather's office, below the bookshelves, is his personal safe. We need the combination.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I never noticed a safe-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Doesn't mean you don't know the combination.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Well, I don't.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: We have it on good authority that you do.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Whose?

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: Five hundred dollars, this cost?

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: What's inside?

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: Cash, cards, ID... and this-

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Useful?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You're on. You've got an hour.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: An hour? I was supposed to have all night to crack him.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: And Saito was supposed to keep his guts on the inside. You've got an hour-get something we can use.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Good authority.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Uncle Peter?! Make them stop-

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: The combination.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I don't know it!

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Why would Browning tell us you did?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Let me talk to him-I'll find out.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You've got an hour. Get talking.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Neither do I, Uncle Peter.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Maurice told me that after he passed only you would be able to open it.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: He never gave me the combination.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: He did, he just didn't tell you that it was a combination.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: What, then?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Something only you would know. Some meaningful combination of numbers from your experiences with Maurice-

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: We didn't have a lot of meaningful experiences together.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Perhaps after your mother died...

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: After my mother died, I went to him in my grief.  You know what he told me? "There's really nothing to be said, Robert."

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: He always had a hard time with emotional-

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I was eleven, Uncle Peter.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: He loved you, Robert. In his way.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: "In his way?" At the end he called me to his deathbed. He could barely speak, but he took the trouble to say one last thing to me. He pulled me close... I could make out only one word. "Disappointed."

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: How's he doing?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: He's in a lot of pain.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: When we get you down to the next level, the pain will be less intense.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: And if he dies?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: His conscious mind will drop out of the dream. He'll be trapped in Limbo for a lifetime...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: What will that do to him?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: When he wakes... his mind could be completely gone.

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: When... when we wake I will still honor our arrangement...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Saito-san, when you wake you might not even remember that we had an arrangement. You'll have forgotten this world. Limbo will be your reality. Lost there so long, you'll have become an old man...

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: Filled with regret?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Waiting to die alone. Yes.

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: Then I'll take the chance and come back. And we'll be young men together again.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: When were you trapped in Limbo?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Cobb, you might have convinced the rest of this team to carry on with the job. But they don't know the truth.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What truth?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: The truth that at any minute you might bring a freight train through the wall. The truth that Mal is bursting up through your subconscious.  The truth that as we go deeper into Fischer, we're also going deeper into you-and I'm not sure we're going to like what we find there.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: This is not just about Fischer, it's about you. Tell me what happened to you and Mal. Trapped in Limbo.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We were on a job. Exploring dreams within dreams. But we didn't understand how your mind can turn hours into years. How you can get trapped. Trapped so deep that when you wash up on the shore of your subconscious...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You can lose track of what's real.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: How long were you stuck?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Fifty years.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: How did you stand it?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We built. We created a whole world for ourselves...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: But not for her?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: She accepted it. At some point...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: And when you finally woke up?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: To wake from that. From decades lived. To be old souls thrown back into youth. It was hard. At first Mal seemed okay. But I started to realize something was wrong. Finally she admitted it. This idea she was possessed by. This simple little idea that changed everything...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: What was it?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: That our world was not real. No matter what I did, no matter what I said, she was convinced that we were still in a dream. That we needed to wake up again...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: What about your children?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: She... she believed they weren't real. That our real children were waiting. Somewhere above...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Calm down, Mal-

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: They're projections, Dom. Your dreams. I'm their mother-don't you think I can tell the difference?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: If it's my dream then why can't I control it? Why can't I stop this?

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: You don't know you're dreaming.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You keep telling me I am-

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: And you don't believe me!

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: Join me.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Mal, come back inside.

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: No. I'm going to jump. And you're coming with me.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No, I'm not. This is real-if you jump, you're not going to wake up, you're going to die. Let's go back inside and talk about this, please.

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: We've talked enough.

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: Come out onto the ledge or I'll jump right now.

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: I'm asking you to take a leap of faith.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I can't do that, Mal. I can't leave our children.

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: If I go without you, they'll take them away, anyway.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: I filed a letter with our attorney. Explaining how I'm fearful for my safety, how you've threatened to kill me...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Out children are here, Mal.

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: You're waiting for a train...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: NO! MAL, NO, I CAN'T!

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: A train that will take you far away...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: DON'T DO THIS!

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: You know where you hope this train will take you, you can't know for sure...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: DON'T!

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: But it doesn't matter...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: mal
Dialogue: Because you'll be together...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: He letter to the authorities refuted all the claims about her sanity that she knew I'd make...

Speaker: thin man
Dialogue: Right now. Or never, Cobb.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Psychiatrists judged her sane?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: She was sane. She was just lost in the labyrinth.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Then why should you blame yourself?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Because we were a family. And we had a life I would do anything to get back to now. But that reality wasn't enough for me then.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: It might have been your idea to push the limits, Cobb. But you're not responsible for the idea that destroyed her. The idea that her world wasn't real... that was her own idea from her own mind.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You don't have to do this for me-

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: I'm doing it for the others. They don't know the risk they've taken coming in here with you.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We can't stay here. Arthur?!

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: These people are going to kill us if we don't give them the combination.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: They won't, they'll try to ransom us-

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: I heard them-they're going to lock us in and run the can into the river.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: What is in the safe?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Something for you. Maurice always said it was his most previous gift... a will.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Maurice's will is with Port and Dunn.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: It's an alternate. It supersedes the other only if you want it to.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: What does it say?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: It splits all the component businesses of Fischer Morrow into individual companies, transferring ownership to the boards of those companies...

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Leaving me nothing?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: A basic living. Nothing more. The entire empire would cease to exist.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Destroy my own inheritance? Why would he suggest such a thing?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: I don't know, Robert.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Come to your senses?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Let us go. I don't know the combination. Not consciously.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Let's try instinctively. I have someone standing in your father's office ready to tap in a combination.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I have no idea-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: RIGHT NOW!

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Five, two, eight... four, nine, one.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You'll have to do better. Bag `em.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: We're worth much more to you alive...

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: His relationship with his father's much worse that we thought.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: That helps us?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: The stronger the issues, the more powerful the catharsis.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: But how do you reconcile them if they're that estranged?

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: I'm working on that.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Well, work fast-Fischer's projections are closing in quick, we need to break out of here before we're totally boxed in...

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Shouldn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, Arthur-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Shifting Fischer's antipathy from his father onto Browning should work.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: We need the imagery, the words...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: So you destroy his one positive relationship?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No. We repair his relationship with his father and expose his godfather's true nature.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Hell, we should be charging Fischer as much as Saito.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: What about his security? It's going to get worse as we go deeper.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We bring in Mr. Charles.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Who's Mr. Charles?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: A bad idea.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Arthur, the second we approach Fischer in that hotel, they're gonna mow us down-we run with Mr. Charles like on the Stein job.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: So you've done it before?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Sure. But it didn't work. The subject realized he was dreaming and his subconscious tore us to pieces.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: You learned a lot, though. Right?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I'll need a decoy.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: No problem. How about a pretty young lady I've used before?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Fine-

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: And don't make the jump too soon- that kick is our only way back, we have to be ready to catch it-

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: I'll use the music to let you know when it's coming, but the rest is up to you.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I have a lot on my mind.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: And there goes Mr. Charles.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Who or what, exactly, is Mr. Charles?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: It's a gambit designed to turn Fischer against his own subconscious.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Mr. Fishcer! Good to see you again. Rod Green, Marketing.  And you must be...

Speaker: blonde
Dialogue: Leaving.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I think you just got blown off... unless her phone number really does have only six digits.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: And why don't you approve?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Because it involves telling the mark that he's dreaming. Which involves attracting a lot of attention to us.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Didn't Cobb say never to do that?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: You must've noticed by now how much time Cobb spends doing things he says never to do.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Strange way to make friends.  Lifting your wallet, I mean.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Goddamn it. The wallet alone's worth-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Five hundred bucks. I know. Don't worry, my guys are on it.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Who did you say you were?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I said I was Rod Green from Marketing-but I'm not. My name is Mr. Charles. I might seem familiar to you. I'm in charge of your security here.

Speaker: blonde
Dialogue: Mr. Saito, can I have a minute?

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but...

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: You look a bit perkier.

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: Turbulence on the plane.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Feels closer. That's Yusuf's driving.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Security? You work for the hotel?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No. My specialty is subconscious security.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: You're talking about dreams. You're talking about extraction.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Exactly. My job is to protect you...

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Get off at a different floor and keep moving. Dump the wallet, then meet me in the lobby. The security will try to track it down. We need to buy Cobb a little more time.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You're not safe here.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Strange weather, huh?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: What's happening?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Cobb's drawing Fischer's attention to the strangeness of the dream. That's making his subconscious look for the dreamer. For me.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Very odd-the weather, the gravity...

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: So you... you're not real?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No. I'm a projection of your subconscious. I was put in place to protect you in the event that extractors pulled you into a dream. I believe that's what has happened.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Hey-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Look at the gun in his hand.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: If this is a dream, I have to kill myself and wake up-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: I wouldn't do that-they've probably got you sedated. If you pull that trigger, you might not wake up, you might drop into a lower dream state.  Mr. Fischer, you know all this, you just have to remember it...

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: So, if everything's correct, this

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What do you remember from before this dream?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Christ-we've been kidnapped.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Where were they holding you?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: They had us... in the back of a van...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Your body's bouncing around in the back of a van right now-that explains the gravity shifts.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: It was... to do with a safe... Christ, why's it so hard to remember?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: It's like trying to remember a dream after you've woken up. It takes years of practice to do it easily. So, you and Browning have been pulled into this dream so they can steal something from your mind. What?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: They wanted a combination to a safe... they demanded the first numbers to pop into my head.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: That's them extracting a locator.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: A locator?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: A number from your own subconscious. It can be used any number of ways...  This is a hotel. Room numbers. What was the number you gave them?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: 5, 2... something... it was a long

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Fifth floor.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Do you use a timer?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No, I have to judge it myself. Once you're all asleep up in room 528, I wait `til Yusuf starts his kick...

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: How will you know?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: His music warns me it's coming, then the van hitting the barrier of the bridge should be unmistakable- that's when I blow the floor out from underneath us and we get a nice synchronized kick. Too soon, and we won't get pulled out; too late and I won't be able to drop us.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: The van will be in free fall. I can't drop us with no gravity.

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: I see you've changed.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: I'm sorry?

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: I'm... I mistook you for a friend.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Good-looking fellow, I'm sure.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: That's Fischer's projection of Browning. We'll keep an eye on how he behaves-

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: How he acts will tell us if Fischer's starting to suspect his motives the way we want him to.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: They work for me.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Mr. Charles!

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You know what this is?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I think so. But I don't understand.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: They were going to put you under.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I'm already under.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Under again.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: A dream within a dream?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Shhhh!

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Uncle Peter. What's going on?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You said you were kidnapped together?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: Not exactly, they already had him. They'd been torturing him...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You saw them torture him?

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: The kidnappers are working for you.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: No, Robert-

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: You're trying to get that safe open. To get the alternate will.

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: Fischer Morrow's been my entire life. I can't let you destroy it.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: I'm not going to throw away my inheritance. Why would I?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: I couldn't take the chance of you rising to your father's final taunt.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: What taunt?

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: That will. I'm sorry, Robert, but it's his final insult. A challenge to build something for yourself. He's telling you that you aren't worthy of his achievements.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: That he was "disappointed?"

Speaker: browning
Dialogue: I'm so sorry. But he was wrong. You'll make his company even greater than he ever could.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Your godfather's lying, Robert.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: How do you know?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: It's what I do. He's hiding something.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Let's find out what.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Let's do to him what he was going to do to you.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We'll penetrate his subconscious and find out what he doesn't want you to know.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: He's out.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Wait, Cobb-I'm lost. Whose subconscious are we going into?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Fischer's. I told him it was Browning's so he'd come with us as part of our team.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: He's going to help us break into his own subconscious.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: That's the idea. He'll think that his security is Browning's and fight them to learn the truth about his father.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Fischer's subconscious is going to run you down hard.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: I'll lead them on a merry chase.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Be back in time for the kick.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: I'm on it.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: What's down there?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Hopefully, the truth we want Fischer to learn.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: I meant what's down there for you?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You're the dreamer. I need you to draw the security away from the complex.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: Then who guides Fischer in? You?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: If I know the route... we could be compromised.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: I designed the place.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No. You're with me.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Eames, brief Saito on the route into the complex. What we're looking for is going to be in the most heavily fortified section. That north tower.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Mr. Fischer, you're going in with Mr. Saito.

Speaker: fischer
Dialogue: You're not coming in?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: You have to do this on your own. You have to get in there, break into your godfather's mind and find out the truth about your father.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Keep this live at all times. I'll be listening in, covering you.  The windows on the upper floors are big enough that I can cover you from that south tower.

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: Bugger.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: yusuf
Dialogue: Sod it. I hope your ready.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No, Yusuf. Too soon!

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: I noticed it twenty minutes ago-at first I thought it was just wind...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: No, it's music. Dammit.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: We move fast. Saito, did you copy?

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: We're going as fast as we can.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: How long do we have?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Yusuf's about ten seconds from the jump, which gives Arthur about three minutes, which gives us about-

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Sixty minutes.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: The route you gave them, can they do it in under an hour?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: I don't think so. They've still got to climb down to the middle terrace.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: They need a new route-a direct route.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: The building's designed as a labyrinth.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: There must be access routes that cut through the maze.  Eames?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Did Eames add any features?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What did he add?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: I shouldn't tell you. If Mal-

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: There's no time-what did he add?

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Utility closets, trap doors...

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: What about service features? Did he add any large pipes or-

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Ducts. He added an air duct system- it doesn't follow the maze. They can use it to go straight from the outer walls to the upper tower.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Explain it to them.

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: Saito?

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: Paradox.

Speaker: saito
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: ariadne
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: The kick.

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: Yeah, we missed it.

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: What the hell do we do now?

Speaker: eames
Dialogue: What next kick?

Speaker: cobb
Dialogue: When the van hits the water. I figure Arthur's got a couple minutes and we've got about twenty.

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: How the hell do I drop you?
